posts.cooked:
Hello, we are having a problem with our VH-109 radio. We are trying to configure it to connect wirelessly. We have it wired so that it takes power from the VRM that is powered by a PDP and running an ethernet cable from the rio directly to the radio. It receives power, but the 2.4 Ghz light isn’t on. All of the other status lights are on and solid. Then when we try to connect to radio.local, it says that the site cannot be reached. Does anyone has guidance for this? 20250120_114335 1920×1440 103 KB

20250120_114335 1920×1440 103 KB

20250120_114335 1920×1440 103 KB

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You don’t need to power it from the VRM , it should be directly wired to the PDP .  To enable the 2.4 GHz AP requires flipping a DIP switch, have you done that?  Have you configured the radio otherwise (eg set the team number)?  Is the computer connected wirelessly to the network (eg has it joined)?
Yes, we have the 3rd and 1st switch flipped on. Let me try to remove the vrm to see if it changes anything.
We were able to connect to the radio a few weeks ago and it had the team number, it just stopped working recently.
Removing the vrm didn’t change anything. The 2.4 ghz light is still off, the network isn’t showing and we cannot connect to radio.local.

posts.name: Aaron
posts.cooked: My recommendation would be to try and reconfigure the network adapter using the new Network Assistant Tool. There you should be able to fix the issue with it not reaching, and also make sure it’s on the newest firmware and formatted correctly.

posts.cooked:

Screenshot (1) 1920×1200 180 KB

Screenshot (1) 1920×1200 180 KB

This is what we see. How do we know which network to choose from?

With ours we needed to set a static Ip address and DNS for the Ethernet. After this we typed 192.168.69.1 into Google and the sight could be accessed.

This being said, vivid hosting created a network assistant tool to help with this since these radios can be such pains in the butt

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked: Less pain in the butt, more…requiring folks to learn networking basics

posts.name: Aaron
posts.cooked:
Connect the VH-109 through the DS port with Ethernet to the computer. Not all computers have an Ethernet port nowadays so you may need the adapter you use for the driver station.

Then you should see an Ethernet option on the tool.

HoneyTrain:

All of the other status lights are on and solid

All the ethernet status lights are on solid? Did you guys load the 1.2.5 or greater firmware update?

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: Connect an Ethernet cable from the radio’s DS to a computer, and then try accessing the IP address 192.168.69.1 in your browser instead of radio.local , as the DNS might not have been set up correctly. If this does not work, use a tool like Angry IP Scanner to perform a manual IP scan, as it can scan the entire IP range for active IPs. Once connected, verify whether the radio is configured as a Robot Radio and NOT as an Access Point and might as well check the firmware version.

The DS port light flickers and for some reason, the RIO port has a light even when there is not cable connected to it. We’ve also run the Vivid Hosting Network Assistant and here are our results: Screenshot (69) 1366×768 85 KB

Screenshot (69) 1366×768 85 KB

Screenshot (69) 1366×768 85 KB

posts.name: JohnRRRR
posts.cooked: What is FRC -4? You should see a LAN connection, or will need one to update the firmware and set up the team number and SSID. Also, unless I’m missing something these radios also require  a WPA pwd to be set.

posts.name: Aaron
posts.cooked: To clarify you are connected to Ethernet into the port on the radio, and selected Ethernet on the Network Assistant?

posts.name: Matt Ellis
posts.cooked: Hey there! We seem to be having the same issue. We connected fine to the radio at first and configured everything, then all of a sudden, network connectivity dropped and nothing works any more. The status lights turn on immediately (for us it’s Power, Sys, and 6G) and remain solid forever (no blinking). We can’t connect to any of the ethernet ports any more (those lights remain turning off even with a cable plugged in). We currently have a support ticket open with VH. Hopefully we get a resolution soon!
Yes, sorry for the late response. We tried using different ethernet cables as well and disabling our firewall, but there is no progress. The network assistant is still showing the same error.

posts.name: Aaron
posts.cooked:
Is ethernet not appearing as an option on the Network Assistant Tool or is it appearing and still failing?

If it’s not appearing as an option in the tool, does the computer see it at all?

posts.name: JohnRRRR
posts.cooked: After you set your team number, did you try to connect on 10.xx.yy.1 or 10.xx.yy.4?  You may also have to set your device to a static ip on a 10.xx.yy.z address
